extension.name: zhong
extension.author: Francesco Zaniol
extension.license: GNU General Public License version 2 only, accessibletemplate Terms and Conditions, other
extension.description:
Zhong

Accessible and elegant templates for Joomla
www.accessibletemplate.com

Installation Guide & Documentation

A complete installation guide for this template can be found at this link: Template installation & configuration guide

Learn here the template features

Learn here the template snippets

Learn here the module positions

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_title
field.label: Website title:
field.description: Write the website title here.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_showTitle
field.label: Show title?
field.description: Show title? ( True = Shown, False = Hidden )

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_subtitle
field.label: Website subtitle:
field.description: Write the website subtitle here.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_showSubtitle
field.label: Show subtitle?
field.description: Show subtitle? ( True = Shown, False = Hidden )

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_showLogo
field.label: Show logo?
field.description: Show the logo image? ( True = Shown, False = Hidden )

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_logoPath
field.label: Your logo:
field.description: Choose the file for your logo. If no file is selected the default template logo is displayed ( ./images/logo.png )

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_logoHeight
field.label: Logo height
field.description:
Height in px. Leave this field to 'auto' if you want the browser to calculate it automatically. However, it is recommended to specify it.
Note that you don't need to write 'px'; for example, write '140' instead of '140px'.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_logoWidth
field.label: Logo width
field.description:
Width in px. Leave this field to 'auto' if you want the browser to calculate it automatically. However, it is recommended to specify it.
Note that you don't need to write 'px'; for example, write '140' instead of '140px'.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_altLogo
field.label: Logo 'alt' attribute:
field.description: The 'alternative text' is a very important attribute for screen-readers. Some usage example: 1) If your logo contains relevant text or it has a relevant meaning then write it here. 2) If your logo is purely decorative then leave the alt attribute blank. 3) If the title is enabled and your logo has the same 'semantic value' then leave it blank. 4) If the title is disabled and your logo contains the name of your organization or some other relevant text, then write it here.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_enable_logoLink
field.label: Logo as a link?
field.description: If true, the logo will be a link to the site homepage

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_presentationAlignment
field.label: Logo/Title/Subtitle alignment:
field.description: Alignment rules for the Logo image, title and subtitle block.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_websiteFavicon
field.label: Your favicon:
field.description: Select your favicon (usually 16x16)

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_fullWidth
field.label: Default Layout Width?
field.description:
Liquid = the layout is flexible, but is bounded by maximum/minimum width; Fixed = the layout will not adapt to browser window; Full = the layout will always adapt to the browser window.
ATTENTION: you need to delete your browser cookies for this option to take effect.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_fixedLayoutWidth
field.label: Fixed layout width (in px)
field.description: Layout width for the fixed layout (in px). Do not write 'px'. For example: do not write '960px', instead write '960'

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_liquidLayoutWidth
field.label: Liquid layout width (in %)
field.description: Layout width for the liquid layout (in %). Do not write '%'. For example: do not write '100%', instead write '100'

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_minLayoutWidth
field.label: Liquid layout min-width (in px)
field.description: Minimum layout width for the liquid layout (in px). Do not write 'px'. For example: do not write '320px', instead write '320'

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_maxLayoutWidth
field.label: Liquid layout max-width (in px)
field.description: Please, do not write 'px', for example: do not write '960px', instead write '960'

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_enable_user_layout_width_resize
field.label: Enable 'layout resize handle'?
field.description:
If enabled, two small arrows will be displayed on the top-left corner of the layout. The user can use this handle to resize the layout width.
ATTENTION: you also need to delete your browser cookies for this option to take effect.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_columnOrder
field.label: Column order:
field.description: Set the order of 'left', 'content' and 'right' columns. For example: 'left-content-right' means that the 'left' column is displayed first, then the 'content' column and then the 'right' column. Default value: 'left-content-right.'

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_enable_customWidth_leftRightColumn
field.label: Custom width for left/right columns?
field.description: Enable a custom width for the left and/or right columns? If set to 'Default', the default width is applied. If set to 'Custom', the chosen width is applied.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customWidth_leftColumn
field.label: Custom with, left column (in %)
field.description: Select width for this element ( in % ). You don't need to write '%', for example, write '22.6' instead of '22.6%'. The Default value is 17% when the right column is displayed; otherwise it is 20%.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customWidth_rightColumn
field.label: Custom with, right column (in %)
field.description: Select width for this element ( in % ). You don't need to write '%', for example, write '22.6' instead of '22.6%'. The Default value is 17% when the left column is displayed; otherwise it is 20%.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_fontSize
field.label: Default font size (in %)
field.description:
Font size expressed in percentage. Default is '100'.
ATTENTION: you need to delete your browser cookies for this option to take effect.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_accessButtonStyle
field.label: Top Bar buttons style
field.description: 'Accessibility panel', 'Mobile site' and 'Night mode' buttons style.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_main_menu_style
field.label: Main menu
field.description: Choose the main menu style

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_side_menu_style
field.label: Side Menu
field.description: Choose the side menu style

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_fontSize_mobile
field.label: Default font size for mobile site (in %)
field.description: Choose default font size in mobile layout, expressed in percentage. Default is 81.25% (13px)

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_mobile_menu_mode
field.label: Menu navigation mode (in mobile)?
field.description: 'Normal': the sub-items of a sub-menu are showed ONLY if the main sub-menu item is active. 'Expandable': If a user tap on a parent item, the sub menu will appear. 'Deep navigation': ALL sub-menus and sub-items are ALWAYS visible and accessible.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_enable_fixed_access_bar
field.label: Top Bar in a fixed position?
field.description: If true, the top bar will always be visible, even when the user is scrolling

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_show_message_screenReaderUsers
field.label: Print the hidden message for screen reader users?
field.description: If set to true, a visually hidden message is printed. The users using screen reader are advised to change the layout to 'Full Access'. The message will be print only in 'Default layout' and only the first time the user visits the site.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_menusMode_fullAccess
field.label: Menu navigation mode in 'full access' layout?
field.description: 'Collapsable': the sub-items of a sub-menu are showed ONLY if the main sub-menu item is active. 'Deep navigation': ALL sub-menus and sub-items are ALWAYS visible and accessbile

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_showLogo_highVisibility
field.label: Enable custom logo for 'high contrast' layout?

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_logoPath_highVisibility
field.label: Select custom logo for 'high contrast' layout:
field.description: Choose a high contrast version of your logo

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_menusMode_highContrast
field.label: Menu navigation mode in 'high contrast' layout?
field.description: 'Collapsable': the sub-items of a sub-menu are showed ONLY if the main sub-menu item is active. 'Deep navigation': ALL sub-menus and sub-items are ALWAYS visible and accessbile

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_headingsLevel
field.label: Document outline mode?
field.description:
'HTML4'=If this option is set, the headings order will follow the structure of the entire document (implicit sectioning. Only ONE h1 and all the other headings will follow the document structure). 'HTML5'=If this option is set, the 'sectioning content outline algorithm' will be used (mostly using 'h1' headings).
The HTML5 tecnique is the latest standards (not supported by older screenreaders).

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_enableHiddenHeadingsDefaultLayout
field.label: Always enable 'section headings'?
field.description: These headings are very useful to screen-reader users to better understand the structure of the page. If set to 'false' these headings will not be printed in 'default-layout' and 'mobile-layout'. Note that, if enabled, these headings are HIDDEN to normal users, but readable by screen readers.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customHeadings_websiteTitle
field.label: Website Title heading?
field.description: Select the heading level for the website's title.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customHeadings_websiteSubtitle
field.label: Website Subtitle heading?
field.description: Select the heading level for the website's subtitle.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customHeadings_websiteLogo
field.label: Website Logo heading?
field.description: Select the heading level for the website's logo. If the title is disabled we recommend to set it to 'h1'. In this case it is IMPORTANT to set the 'alt' attribute for the logo.

field.label: Custom headings level (section headings)
field.description: Each important section of the page (for example: the main menu, the login form...) is linked to a descriptive heading. These headings are active by default in the 'Full Access' layout. They are very important for screen readers because they give a better page structure.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customHeadings_locationPath
field.label: 'Location path' heading?
field.description: Select the heading level; Note that you can also select to disable the heading. The 'default' value means following the HTML4 or HTML5 order mode.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customHeadings_headerMenu
field.label: 'Header Menu' heading?
field.description: Select the heading level; Note that you can also select to disable the heading. The 'default' value means following the HTML4 or HTML5 order mode.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customHeadings_languageOptions
field.label: 'Language Options' heading?
field.description: Select the heading level; Note that you can also select to disable the heading. The 'default' value means following the HTML4 or HTML5 order mode.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customHeadings_search
field.label: 'Search' heading?
field.description: Select the heading level; Note that you can also select to disable the heading. The 'default' value means following the HTML4 or HTML5 order mode.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customHeadings_topMenu
field.label: 'Main menu' heading?
field.description: Select the heading level; Note that you can also select to disable the heading. The 'default' value means following the HTML4 or HTML5 order mode.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customHeadings_mainMenu
field.label: 'Side menu' heading?
field.description: Select the heading level; Note that you can also select to disable the heading. The 'default' value means following the HTML4 or HTML5 order mode.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customHeadings_additionalResourcesLeft
field.label: 'Additional resources (left column)' heading?
field.description: Select the heading level; Note that you can also select to disable the heading. The 'default' value means following the HTML4 or HTML5 order mode.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customHeadings_login
field.label: 'Login' heading?
field.description: Select the heading level; Note that you can also select to disable the heading. The 'default' value means following the HTML4 or HTML5 order mode.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customHeadings_additionalResourcesRight
field.label: 'Additional resources (right column)' heading?
field.description: Select the heading level; Note that you can also select to disable the heading. The 'default' value means following the HTML4 or HTML5 order mode.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customHeadings_mainContent
field.label: 'Main Content' heading?
field.description: Select the heading level; Note that you can also select to disable the heading. The 'default' value means following the HTML4 or HTML5 order mode.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customHeadings_supplementaryContentUpper
field.label: 'Supplementary Content (upper)' heading?
field.description: Select the heading level; Note that you can also select to disable the heading. The 'default' value means following the HTML4 or HTML5 order mode.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customHeadings_supplementaryContentLower
field.label: 'Supplementary Content (lower)' heading?
field.description: Select the heading level; Note that you can also select to disable the heading. The 'default' value means following the HTML4 or HTML5 order mode.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customHeadings_footer
field.label: 'Footer' heading?
field.description: Select the heading level; Note that you can also select to disable the heading. The 'default' value means following the HTML4 or HTML5 order mode.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customHeadings_footerMenu
field.label: 'Footer menu' heading?
field.description: Select the heading level; Note that you can also select to disable the heading. The 'default' value means following the HTML4 or HTML5 order mode.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customHeadings_quickLinksMenu
field.label: 'Quick links menu' heading?
field.description: Select the heading level; Note that you can also select to disable the heading. The 'default' value means following the HTML4 or HTML5 order mode.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customHeadings_accessibilityOptions
field.label: 'Accessibility options' heading?
field.description: Select the heading level; Note that you can also select to disable the heading. The 'default' value means following the HTML4 or HTML5 order mode.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customHeadings_modulesOnaccessibilityPanel
field.label: Heading level of the modules in the accessibility panel?
field.description: Select the heading level.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_sameHeight_customModules
field.label: Same height modules?
field.description: Force custom modules in the same row to have the same height

field.label:
Set the style for your custom modules:
- Default: some style is added, some margins and paddings applied.
- Plain: no style added, some margins and paddings applied.
- Full Width: no style added, no margins nor padding.
- Light: a light style applied, some margins and paddings applied.
- Dark: a dark style applied, some margins and paddings applied.
- Menu container: set this style if the module contains a menu
- {color}: colored module, some margins and paddings applied.
- User custom {n}: Define your custom style below!

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customUserModuleStyle_1_borderStyle
field.label: Border style
field.description: Select CSS border style, i.e. 'solid', 'dotted', 'dashed'

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customUserModuleStyle_1_borderWidth
field.label: Border width
field.description: Example: write '1px' if you want to specify a measure in all four sides of the box (top, left, bottom and right). Instead, write '1px 0px 3px 2px' if you need to specify different measures for the sides (in this case, '1px' for top, '0px' for right, '3px' for bottom and '2px' for the left side)

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customUserModuleStyle_1_margin
field.label: Margin
field.description: Example: write '1px' if you want to specify a measure in all four sides of the box (top, left, bottom and right). Instead, write '1px 0px 3px 2px' if you need to specify different measures for the sides (in this case, '1px' for top, '0px' for right, '3px' for bottom and '2px' for the left side)

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customUserModuleStyle_1_padding
field.label: Padding
field.description: Example: write '1px' if you want to specify a measure in all four sides of the box (top, left, bottom and right). Instead, write '1px 0px 3px 2px' if you need to specify different measures for the sides (in this case, '1px' for top, '0px' for right, '3px' for bottom and '2px' for the left side)

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customUserModuleStyle_2_borderStyle
field.label: Border style
field.description: Select CSS border style, i.e. 'solid', 'dotted', 'dashed'

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customUserModuleStyle_2_borderWidth
field.label: Border width
field.description: Example: write '1px' if you want to specify a measure in all four sides of the box (top, left, bottom and right). Instead, write '1px 0px 3px 2px' if you need to specify different measures for the sides (in this case, '1px' for top, '0px' for right, '3px' for bottom and '2px' for the left side)

field.label: Margin
field.description: Example: write '1px' if you want to specify a measure in all four sides of the box (top, left, bottom and right). Instead, write '1px 0px 3px 2px' if you need to specify different measures for the sides (in this case, '1px' for top, '0px' for right, '3px' for bottom and '2px' for the left side)

field.label: Border style

Instead, write '1px 0px 3px 2px' if you need to specify different measures for the sides (in this case, '1px' for top, '0px' for right, '3px' for bottom and '2px' for the left side)

field.label: Please note that this tool is suitable only for basic style customizations. For complex modifications open the tab 'Advanced options' and follow the instructions.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customColor_buttons_BorderStyle
field.label: border style
field.description: Select CSS border style, i.e. 'solid', 'dotted', 'dashed'

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customColor_buttons_BorderWidth
field.label: border width
field.description: Example: write '1px' if you want to specify a measure in all four sides of the box (top, left, bottom and right). Instead, write '1px 0px 3px 2px' if you need to specify different measures for the sides (in this case, '1px' for top, '0px' for right, '3px' for bottom and '2px' for the left side)

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_enable_customFontSize_title
field.label: Website Title Font Size:
field.description: Enable custom font size for this element? If set to 'Default', the default size is applied. If set to 'Custom', the chosen size is applied.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customFontSize_title
field.label: custom font size (in 'em')
field.description: Select font size in 'em'. Note that you don't need to write 'em', for example, write '1.2' instead of '1.2em'. Default value is 3.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_enable_customFontSize_subtitle
field.label: Website Subtitle Font Size:
field.description: Enable custom font size for this element? If set to 'Default', the default size is applied. If set to 'Custom', the chosen size is applied.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customFontSize_subtitle
field.label: custom font size (in 'em')
field.description: Select font size in 'em'. Note that you don't need to write 'em', for example, write '1.2' instead of '1.2em'. Default value is 1.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customColor_layoutBorderStyle
field.label: border style
field.description: Select CSS border style, i.e. 'solid', 'dotted', 'dashed'

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customColor_layoutBorderWidth
field.label: border width
field.description: Example: write '1px' if you want to specify a measure in all four sides of the box (top, left, bottom and right). Instead, write '1px 0px 3px 2px' if you need to specify different measures for the sides (in this case, '1px' for top, '0px' for right, '3px' for bottom and '2px' for the left side)

field.label: border style
field.description: Select CSS border style, i.e. 'solid', 'dotted', 'dashed'

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customColor_sideMenus_linksBorder1Width
field.label: border width
field.description: Example: write '1px' if you want to specify a measure in all four sides of the box (top, left, bottom and right). Instead, write '1px 0px 3px 2px' if you need to specify different measures for the sides (in this case, '1px' for top, '0px' for right, '3px' for bottom and '2px' for the left side)

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customColor_sideMenus_linksBorderSubStyle
field.label: border style
field.description: Select CSS border style, i.e. 'solid', 'dotted', 'dashed'

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customColor_sideMenus_linksBorderSubWidth
field.label: border width
field.description: Example: write '1px' if you want to specify a measure in all four sides of the box (top, left, bottom and right). Instead, write '1px 0px 3px 2px' if you need to specify different measures for the sides (in this case, '1px' for top, '0px' for right, '3px' for bottom and '2px' for the left side)

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customFonts_imported1_googleFontURL
field.label: [imported 1] Google Font URL
field.description:
Import here your custom Google font.
Example: http://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Alef:400,700

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customFonts_imported2_googleFontURL
field.label: [imported 2] Google Font URL

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customFonts_general_fontFamily
field.label: (custom) CSS font family:
field.description:
Set here your custom font family or google font.
Example(native): Arial, Helvetica Neue, Helvetica, sans-serif
Example(google font): 'Alef', sans-serif

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customFonts_heading_fontFamily
field.label: (custom) CSS font family:
field.description:
Set here your custom font family or google font.
Example(native): Arial, Helvetica Neue, Helvetica, sans-serif
Example(google font): 'Alef', sans-serif

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customFonts_websiteTitle_fontFamily
field.label: (custom) CSS font family:
field.description:
Set here your custom font family or google font.
Example(native): Arial, Helvetica Neue, Helvetica, sans-serif
Example(google font): 'Alef', sans-serif

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customFonts_websiteSubtitle_fontFamily
field.label: (custom) CSS font family:
field.description:
Set here your custom font family or google font.
Example(native): Arial, Helvetica Neue, Helvetica, sans-serif
Example(google font): 'Alef', sans-serif

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_customFonts_mainMenu_fontFamily
field.label: (custom) CSS font family:
field.description:
Set here your custom font family or google font.
Example(native): Arial, Helvetica Neue, Helvetica, sans-serif
Example(google font): 'Alef', sans-serif

field.label:
Define here your custom tags to be included in the document head. You can add custom META tags, external scripts, css stylesheets, Facebook's open graph META tags etc.

Example 1: type='link', attribute 1='rel', attribute 1 content='stylesheet', attribute 2='type', attribute 2 content='text/css', attribute 3='href', attribute 3 content='mystyle.css'. It will print the tag:
‹link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="mystyle.css"/›

Example 2 (Facebook open graph): type='meta', attribute 1='property', attribute 1 content='og:image', attribute 2='content', attribute 2 content='myImage.jpg'. It will print the tag:
‹meta property="og:image" content="myImage.jpg"/›

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_show_message_IEusers
field.label: Show the hidden message to Internet Explorer users?
field.description: If set to true, a warning message will appear to users using obsolete version of Internet Explorer ( IE version 7 or less ). If IE6, it is suggested to update the browser and switch to 'Full Access layout'. Note that the message will be print ONLY the first time the user visits the website.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_show_access_button_message
field.label: Show welcome + preferences message?
field.description: If set to true, a message will appear, welcoming the user and indicating the button for opening the accessibility panel.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_enable_JStooltips
field.label: Enable Javascript tooltips?
field.description: These tooltips are showed using javascript and not the native browser engine. They are enabled only in 'default layout'.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_enable_googleAnalytics
field.label: Enable Google Analytics?
field.description: If true, fill the field below

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_googleAnalytics_ID
field.label: Google Analytics Tracking ID
field.description: Do not instert 'UA-'. For example, a correct value would be '12345678-1'

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_print_font_type
field.label: Font for printing?
field.description: Select the default font for printing. Remember that if the user hasn't installed the font there will be a fallback into serif or sans serif family.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_print_font_size
field.label: Font size for printing?
field.description: Select the font proportions for printing.
field.option: Big (best readability, more ink and paper used)

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_print_show_header
field.label: When printing, show header? (logo, title and subtitle)

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_enable_jquery_library
field.label: Include jQuery library from template?
field.description: Set this option to false if you want to include a different version of the jQuery library or another component is already including it. Note that Joomla 3.x or higher includes the jquery library by default.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_enable_modernizr_library
field.label: Include modernizr library? (see description)
field.description: WARNING! to activate this library you need to download your custom build and paste it into: 'JOOMLA-ROOT-DIR/template/TEMPLATE_NAME/assets/javascript/modernizr/modernizr.js'. This file is EMPTY by default.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_enable_php_debugger
field.label: Enable PHP debug mode?
field.description: This option could help you find out possible errors in the PHP code.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_enable_javascript_debugger
field.label: Enable Firebug Lite and Javascript debug mode?
field.description: This option could help you find out possible errors in the javascript code.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_prevent_javascript_errors_IE_alert
field.label: Prevent IE8< to alert javascript errors?
field.description: Use with caution.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_enable_minify_methods
field.label: Enable minify scripts?
field.description: If true, CSS and JS will be minified, cached and compressed in a single file. It is preferred to set it to 'false' if you are developing.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_header_mobile_style
field.label: Mobile top bar style:
field.description: If 'icon' is selected then the 'font-face' rule is used. This rule is not well supported by some mobile devices, by the way, a fallback is provided. Use 'image' if you want full compatibility or for testing

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_global_layout_width_type
field.label: Global layout width type
field.description: 'Contained': the whole layout will be restricted by a container. 'Stretched': the layout elements are stretched. Note that for every template only ONE option is the default one. If you choose the other options you will need to adapt the CSS style (only for developers).

field.label: ATTENTION: if you need to hack the template's style we discourage modifications to the native CSS files. Instead we highly recommend to override the specific CSS rule by using the 'Your custom CSS' option (see below) OR the 'overrides.css' file.

field.name: zhongframework_Jparam_custom_user_inlineCSS
field.label: Your custom CSS (see description):
field.description:
Include here your custom CSS code (For example 'a{color:#500;}').
ATTENTION: these rules will be included ONLY in 'default layout' and in 'mobile layout'. If you want to add style for the other layouts (high-contrast layout and full access layout) then you need to edit the overrides.css file (see description below).
HINT: the 'body' element has different classes depending on the active graphic mode. Use the classes 'body.night-mode' or 'body.best-legibility' or 'body.default-graphic-mode' to target these graphic modes.

field.label:
To load your custom CSS code, edit the file:
TEMPLATE_DIRECTORY/assets/custom-overrides/css/overrides.css

To load your custom Javascript code, edit the file:
TEMPLATE_DIRECTORY/assets/custom-overrides/js/custom-scripts.js

Installation Guide & Documentation
Template installation & configuration guide
Template features
Template snippets
Module positions

Bugs reporting & feedback
Our first priority is to ensure that our templates are quality products and our users satisfied. Therefore you opinions and advices are very important!
- If you find a bug please report it to us by sending an email to info@accessibletemplate.com
- If you have any suggestion to improve our templates and their accessibility level you are welcome to contact us at info@accessibletemplate.com

Infos & translation
If you need more information about our templates you are welcome to contact us at info@accessibletemplate.com
Contact us also if you are interested in helping us translate our templates into a new language (please visit our website first to check the languages that are already available).

Support
Do you need support for the template? our clients are welcome to contact us at support@accessibletemplate.com, we will be happy to help you
